AdditionalFields.Value: Population Sciences,Bioinformatics / Computational Biology / Systems Biology / Convergent Science,Global Health

Description: In this session, we will discuss the current state-of-the-art for the use of ‘omic data in population science studies.  Lectures will include discussion of how ‘omic data can be used to identify, refine, and enrich exposure-disease relationships by serving as markers for the exposome, surrogates for disease outcomes, and mediators of oncogenesis.  Additionally, examples of integration of ‘omic data as a means to gain deeper biological understanding and leveraging extant ‘omic datasets to address new hypotheses will be presented.
SearchResultBody: APS02. Population Sciences in the Era of Omics
Title: Population Sciences in the Era of Omics
